title: REFACTOR: bashx integration & ESM optimization
description:
Integrate with bashx.do and optimize for ESM packages.

## bashx Integration
```typescript
// In bashx TieredExecutor
case 'npm':
  return this.npmx.handleNpm(args)
case 'npx':
  return this.npmx.handleNpx(args)
```

## ESM Optimization
- Detect ESM-only packages
- Use esm.sh/skypack for simple imports
- Skip extraction for pure ESM packages
- Generate import maps

## Caching Strategy
- fsx handles storage tiers automatically
- Add in-memory metadata cache
- Cache resolved dependency trees

title: RED: npm run script tests
Runner Layer - Script & Package Execution
description:
Execute npm scripts and npx packages via bashx.do.

## Responsibilities
1. **Script Parsing**: Parse package.json scripts section
2. **Environment Setup**: Set PATH, npm_* variables
3. **Binary Resolution**: Find executables in node_modules/.bin
4. **npx Execution**: Download, run, cleanup temporary packages

## API
```typescript
interface ScriptRunner {
  // Run npm script
  run(script: string, args?: string[]): Promise<RunResult>
  
  // Execute npx package
  exec(package: string, args?: string[]): Promise<RunResult>
  
  // Find binary in node_modules
  findBin(name: string): Promise<string | null>
}
```

## Environment Variables
- `PATH` prepended with `node_modules/.bin`
- `npm_package_name`, `npm_package_version`
- `npm_lifecycle_event` (script name)
- `npm_config_*` for npm config values

title: npmx.do - NPM/NPX for Edge Runtimes
description:
Edge-native package management - run `npm install` and `npx` without Node.js.

## Architecture

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                        npmx.do                              │
│  ┌─────────────┐  ┌─────────────┐  ┌─────────────────────┐ │
│  │  Registry   │  │  Resolver   │  │      Runner         │ │
│  │  - fetch    │  │  - semver   │  │  - npm run          │ │
│  │  - metadata │  │  - tree     │  │  - npx exec         │ │
│  │  - extract  │  │  - lockfile │  │  - scripts          │ │
│  └──────┬──────┘  └──────┬──────┘  └──────────┬──────────┘ │
└─────────┼────────────────┼────────────────────┼────────────┘
          ▼                ▼                    ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                        fsx.do                               │
│         (handles all storage - SQLite hot, R2 cold)         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Key Insight
npmx just uses fsx.do as a filesystem - fsx handles tiered storage (SQLite/R2) automatically. No R2 logic in npmx.

## Commands to Support
- `npm install <package>`
- `npm install` (from package.json)
- `npm run <script>`
- `npx <package>` 
- `npx <package>@<version>`

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Install package from npm registry
- [ ] Resolve semver versions correctly
- [ ] Build dependency tree with deduplication
- [ ] Run package.json scripts
- [ ] Execute npx packages (download + run + cleanup)
- [ ] Integration with bashx.do

title: Resolver Layer - Dependency Resolution
description:
Resolve dependencies using semver and build installation tree.

## Responsibilities
1. **Semver Resolution**: Match version ranges to available versions
2. **Dependency Tree**: Build tree from package.json dependencies
3. **Deduplication**: Hoist compatible versions to reduce duplication
4. **Lock Files**: Read/write package-lock.json for reproducible builds
5. **Peer Dependencies**: Handle peer dep requirements

## API
```typescript
interface DependencyResolver {
  // Resolve single package version
  resolve(name: string, range: string): Promise<string>
  
  // Build full dependency tree
  buildTree(packageJson: PackageJson): Promise<DependencyTree>
  
  // Read lock file
  readLockfile(path: string): Promise<Lockfile>
  
  // Write lock file
  writeLockfile(path: string, tree: DependencyTree): Promise<void>
}
```

## Semver Ranges
- `^1.2.3` → >=1.2.3 <2.0.0
- `~1.2.3` → >=1.2.3 <1.3.0
- `1.2.x` → >=1.2.0 <1.3.0
- `*` → any version

title: Build @dotdo/npmx (core) + npmx.do (service)
description:
Build npmx following the fsx pattern (currently mostly empty):

**@dotdo/npmx (core/)** - Pure library, zero CF deps:
- Semver parsing and comparison
- Version range resolution (^, ~, >=, etc.)
- Dependency tree building
- Package.json parsing and validation
- Tarball structure parsing
- Types and errors
- RegistryBackend interface

**npmx.do (root)** - Managed service:
- Registry HTTP client (fetch from npmjs.com)
- Package caching with DO storage
- Tarball extraction to fsx.do
- npx-style execution with bashx.do
- CLI (npx npmx.do install, run, etc.)
- App.mdx, Site.mdx

title: Registry Layer - npm Registry Client
description:
Fetch packages from npm registry and extract to fsx.do.

## Responsibilities
1. **Metadata Fetching**: GET package info from registry.npmjs.org
2. **Tarball Download**: Fetch .tgz package files
3. **Extraction**: Untar/ungzip to fsx.do filesystem
4. **Caching**: Let fsx handle storage (auto-tiers to R2 for large files)

## API
```typescript
interface RegistryClient {
  // Get package metadata
  getPackage(name: string): Promise<PackageMetadata>
  
  // Get specific version
  getVersion(name: string, version: string): Promise<VersionMetadata>
  
  // Download and extract to fsx
  install(name: string, version: string, dest: string): Promise<void>
}
```

## Registry API
- `GET https://registry.npmjs.org/<package>` → full metadata
- `GET https://registry.npmjs.org/<package>/<version>` → version metadata
- Tarball URL in `dist.tarball` field

- Custom routes: Packages, Versions, Dependencies, Publish, Registry, Scripts

**Site.mdx:**

- Hero section with code tabs (SDK and CLI examples)

- Re-exports core modules
- Exports CLI functions
- npm/npx SDK interfaces and factory functions
